title: ODE collision space not deleted when model is removed from the world

content.raw:
When removing models from the world using ODE, the collision space for these models lingers, causing the simulation to become quadratically slower over time.

The collision space for a model is tracked by `ODEPhysics::dataPtr::spaces`, which is populated in `ODEPhysics::CreateLink()` (#!/osrf/gazebo/src/47c6f792045ae8e67f3aa3ba64c07006151f470c/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEPhysics.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#ODEPhysics.cc-494). However, no code is present anywhere to remove this space once a model is no longer active. This causes the quadratic performance degredation as further detailed in [this question on Gazebo Answers](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/11998/why-does-performance-decrease-when-removing-inserting-models/).

It appears to me the solution is to introduce an `ODEModel` class to manage the collision space. This is exactly what I have done in the attached patch file, which appears to make the slowdown go away.
